message_1:
Consider the relevance logic statement: "If P is not relevant to Q and Q is true, then P can be anything." 

Suppose P can take any value between 1 and 5, inclusive. If Q is true and P is not relevant to Q, how many possible values can P take?
message_2: Since P is not relevant to Q and can be anything, it can take any value between 1 and 5, inclusive. There are 5 possible values for P: 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5.
